Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2008 03:31PM HKitty71 wrote: actually my PS used lidocaine before he removed, he counted to 3 and just pulled them out, you might feel a little pressure but it is not bad. Just had the second one out Friday and did not feel a thing.

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2008 02:35AM HKitty71 wrote: I really hope everyone above is doing well!!  I am having a lumpectomy on the 25th of this month with the sentinel node biopsy. I was told I would be off of work for a week, I did ask how soon I would be able to starting working (like moving a mouse for a living is heavy) and I was told no weight lifting. But looking at some of these I am pretty nervous now. I really did not have any pain with the biopsy just could not sleep on my stomach (I had seen some of my friends pretty beat up so to speak after theirs, and lucky for them they were all non cancerous) so I was really hoping that this would be similar experience.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy & axillary dissection ?? loriann frogger

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2008 07:18AM HKitty71 wrote: Thanks so much, my PS did give me permission today for short trip driving after he took out 1 of my drains, still got the other and I am kind of glad. I had a bad experience with the original surgery in April. Had a lumpectomy and developed a nasty seroma(sp) which lead to so much fluid building up that well it pretty much blew out the incision. Please keep in mind this does not happen to a lot of people just a few of us but the drains while a total nuisance are a good tool, just a pain to drag around. They do add an extra 10 minutes or more to getting ready.

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2008 10:26AM HKitty71 wrote: Toni, I am sorry to hear you are having the problems and having to quit smoking at the same time. Pain in the butt.  I quit smoking 2 weeks prior to my mastectomy on the 23rd or May ( I was a 2 pack a day girl for a long time). I hate to say I am glad I did, I am healing so much better than I did when I smoked during the lumpectomy in April. Not smoking really helps with the healing. Heck it also gives you something else to focus on besides the breast cancer and the circus that seems to surround it. I also gained weight on top of my chubbiness I ate to cope. You are in my hopes and prayers as are all of the ladies on these boards. We are in it together.
